SNYK_CC_GCP_289.impact: Disconnection logs will not be available for troubleshooting or investigations

SNYK_CC_K8S_1.impact: Compromised container could potentially modify the underlying host’s kernel by loading unauthorized modules (i.e. drivers).

SNYK_CC_K8S_10.title: Container is running without root user control

SNYK_CC_K8S_11.impact: UID of the container processes could clash with host's UIDs and lead to unintentional authorization bypass

SNYK_CC_K8S_12.impact: Might cause unexpected network connectivity issues

SNYK_CC_K8S_13.impact: Containers will be able to communicate with host's shared channels. This breaks container security boundary.

references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.16 Ensure that the host's IPC namespace is not shared
SNYK_CC_K8S_13.resolve: Remove `hostIPC` attribute, or set value to `false`

SNYK_CC_K8S_14.impact: Containers will be able to access host's networking resources. This breaks container security boundary.

references: CIS Docker Benchmark 1.2.0 - 5.9 Ensure that the host's network namespace is not shared
SNYK_CC_K8S_14.resolve: Remove `hostNetwork` attribute, or set value to `false`
SNYK_CC_K8S_14.title: Container is running in host's Network namespace

SNYK_CC_K8S_15.impact: This allows access to any traffic to the Node Security Group(s), potentially meaning everyone can access your service.
SNYK_CC_K8S_15.issue: Defining a Load balancer Service without setting the loadBalancerSourceRanges property will use the default value of 0.0.0.0/0.
SNYK_CC_K8S_15.resolve: Set `loadBalancerSourceRanges` attribute value to specific IP addresses
SNYK_CC_K8S_15.title: Service does not restrict ingress sources

SNYK_CC_K8S_16.impact: Pods will be able to run with `privileged` mode.
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.6.0 - 5.2.1 Minimize the admission of privileged containers
SNYK_CC_K8S_16.resolve: Remove `privileged` attribute, or set vault to `false`

SNYK_CC_K8S_17.impact: Pods will be able to run with `allowPrivilegeEscalation` set to true (default value).

references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.6.0 - 5.2.5 Minimize the admission of containers with allowPrivilegeEscalation

SNYK_CC_K8S_19.impact: Containers will be able to enumerate and interact with host's processes. This breaks container security boundary
SNYK_CC_K8S_19.issue: Policy does not prevent containers from running processes inside of host's PID namespace
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.6.0 - 5.2.2 Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host process ID namespace
SNYK_CC_K8S_19.resolve: Remove `hostPID` attribute, or set value to `false`

SNYK_CC_K8S_20.impact: Containers will be able to communicate with host's shared channels. This breaks container security boundary.
SNYK_CC_K8S_20.issue: Policy does not prevent containers from running processes inside of host's IPC namespace
references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.6.0 - 5.2.3 Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host IPC namespace
SNYK_CC_K8S_20.resolve: Remove the `hostIPC` attribute, or set value to `false`

SNYK_CC_K8S_21.impact: Containers will be able to access host's networking resources. This breaks container security boundary.

references: CIS Kubernetes Benchmark 1.6.0 - 5.2.4 Minimize the admission of containers wishing to share the host network namespace
SNYK_CC_K8S_21.resolve: Remove `hostNetwork` attribute, or set value to `false`
SNYK_CC_K8S_21.title: Policy allows sharing of host's Network namespace

SNYK_CC_K8S_3.issue: The pod is sharing host's PID namespace
